Introduction

The Vision Apps package consists of vision, perception demos/applications for J7 Pre-Silicon platform

Licensing

Refer to Processor SDK RTOS Automotive manifest at top level.

Getting Started

The Vision Apps User Guide [HTML] provides the documentation and references necessary to begin development on TI's platforms using Vision Apps.

Documentation

Refer to following documentation for further details:

Vision Apps User Guide Build instructions, API Guide [HTML]

What's New

Here are a few of the new features supported in this release:

  1. ADASVISION-1795 Demo: Image Classification Demo - file IO based
  2. ADASVISION-1796 Demo: CNN based object detect - file IO based
  3. ADASVISION-1797 Build: Setup makefile based build to compile for J7 SoC
  4. ADASVISION-1798 Integration: Integrate TI-RTOS on Main R5F's, A72, C6x, C7x, MCU R5F's
  5. ADASVISION-1799 Integration: Integrate TI-RTOS IPC LLD on Main R5F, A72, C6x, C7x, MCU R5F
  6. ADASVISION-1800 Integration: Integrate console IO
  7. ADASVISION-1801 Integration: Integrate TIOVX TI-RTOS only
  8. ADASVISION-1802 Integration: Provide APIs to allocate memory from a shared cached region

Upgrade and Compatibility Information

Not applicable. First release.

Validation Information

This release was built and validated using the following tools:

Build Tools (included in Processor SDK RTOS Automotive):

  • C7000 Code Generation Tools version: 1.0
  • C6000 Code Generation Tools version: 8.2.4
  • ARM R5F Code Generation Tools version: 16.9.4

Build Tools (NOT included in Processor SDK RTOS Automotive):

  • ARM A72 Code Generation Tools version: gcc-linaro-7.2.1-2017.11-x86_64_aarch64-elf

Dependencies (included in Processor SDK RTOS Automotive):

  • BIOS version: 6.75
  • XDC Tools version: 3.50
  • Platform Development Kit (PDK) version: 0.3
  • TIDL version: 0.3
  • TIOVX version: 1.3
  • VXLIB version: 1.1.3
  • Perception Toolkit (PTK) version: 0.2
  • Processor SDK RTOS Automotive version: 0.3

Dependencies (NOT included in Processor SDK RTOS Automotive):

  • GCC: 5.4.0
  • libpng: 1.2
  • OpenCV: 2.4.9
  • GLM: 0.9.9.0
  • GLEW: 2.0.0
  • SDL, SDL_Image: 2.0
Refer user guide [HTML] for instructions to install and setup above dependancies.

Technical Support

For technical support and additional assistance, contact local TI Field Application Engineer

Package Versioning

Each package version is composed of 4 period-delimited numbers - represented here by the letters M, m, p and b [M.m.p.b]. The table below provides a descriptive reference regarding package version numbering.

Digit Meaning Description
1 (M=Major) Major revision Incremented when the new version is substantially different from the previous For example, a new module added or an existing module's algorithm significantly altered.
2 (m=minor) Minor revision Incremented when the new version has changed but not in a major way. For example, some minor changes in the API or feature set.
3 (p=patch) Patch number Incremented for all other source code changes. This include any packaging support code.
4 (b=build) Build number Incremented for each release delivery to CM. Reset for any change to M, m or p
